WorkItem.Description: In VS2012 (VB.NET) I am trying to use this tool with a Class Library project (and eventually also created a Configuration Section Project). I have created my diagram but the tool fails to generate any code. I get the warning "The custom tool 'CsdFileGenerator' failed.  Unrecognized Guid format." and then nothing happens.
WorkItem.Summary: The custom tool 'CsdFileGenerator' failed.  Unrecognized Guid format.

Comments.Message: Any news on this? It's stopping me using the tool...

I eventually worked round this by creating my configuration settings designer in a seperate (temporary) solution where it was the only project. This worked, and I could design my CSD files.

Source Control:
1. For source control integration, I just manually copied the relevant files into my main solution after making any changes in this temporary project. 
2. You can of course set this up that this "seperate" solution/project is in the same folder, then you dont have to copy the files manually from some other location all the time.
Potential Fix is checked in to TFS and in latest VS2013 package. Will close once it is deployed as download package for VS2012 and confirmed.
